projects.title: AVRYai AI Receptionist Platform
projects.description: Voice-first receptionist platform split across API, telephony gateway, and web surfaces.
projects.evidence_summary: Evidence: 21 service modules, 5 migration scripts, 9 automation pipeline modules.
what_i_built: Split runtime responsibilities between `api/` and `voice-gateway/` for call orchestration and business logic.
Implemented router and service layers for clients, billing, onboarding, leads, SMS, and scheduling workflows.
Added migration scripts for schema updates and backfills under `api/migrations/`.
Maintained deployment scripts and container definitions for separate API and voice service releases.
hard_problems: Coordinating telephony webhooks, websocket media streams, and backend state updates.
Managing evolving schema and backfill requirements while services continue running.
Keeping service boundaries stable while integrating multiple third-party providers.
architecture_snapshot: Inbound calls enter a telephony provider and are routed into `voice-gateway/server.js`.
Voice gateway forwards events to FastAPI routes in `api/main.py` and `api/routers/`.
Business workflows are implemented in dedicated modules under `api/services/`.
Data persistence is handled through Postgres-aware service code and migration scripts.
Web layer exists in `web/` for public-facing product and onboarding surface.
Deployment automation is split into `deploy-api.sh` and `deploy-voice.sh`.

key_directories: `api/routers/` contains route modules for clients, billing, onboarding, leads, and calendar.
`api/services/` contains service modules for SMS, Twilio, Stripe, calendar, reminders, and analysis.
`api/migrations/` stores schema migration and backfill scripts.
`voice-gateway/` hosts call/webhook handling and streaming entrypoints.

projects.title: Chatty Multi-Interface LLM Client
projects.description: Monorepo chat system with web, API, and CLI interfaces backed by Prisma and Postgres.
projects.evidence_summary: Evidence: 3 app packages, 18 Prisma migration directories, 11 provider/LLM pipeline modules.
what_i_built: Structured a monorepo with `apps/web`, `apps/api`, and `apps/cli` packages.
Implemented streaming and non-streaming chat paths plus conversation export endpoints.
Added Prisma migration history and project/memory models under `apps/api/prisma/`.
Built CLI interaction flow and command surface through the `chatty` binary package.
hard_problems: Keeping API behavior consistent across browser and terminal clients.
Supporting SSE chat streaming while preserving conversation persistence.
Managing schema evolution over many migration revisions in active development.
architecture_snapshot: Next.js frontend in `apps/web/` talks to the API service in `apps/api/`.
CLI in `apps/cli/` consumes the same backend endpoints for parity.
API entrypoint `apps/api/src/index.ts` handles chat, conversations, and project state.
Provider and model routing logic is separated under `apps/api/src/providers/` and `apps/api/src/llm/`.
Postgres is provisioned by `docker-compose.yml` on local port 5433.
Prisma schema and migrations under `apps/api/prisma/` track database changes.

key_directories: `apps/api/src/` for Express API handlers, providers, and LLM routing.
how_it_runs: Run services: `pnpm dev` from repo root.

projects.title: Beary Trading Dashboard
projects.description: Trading dashboard and research system with live market APIs, websocket updates, and analytics endpoints.
projects.evidence_summary: Evidence: 6 backend service modules, 2 SQL migration scripts, 19 scanner/trading pipeline modules.
what_i_built: Split dashboard stack into backend API (`dashboard/backend`) and frontend app (`dashboard/frontend`).
Implemented REST endpoints for candles, orderbook, news, analytics, and account/trade views.
Added websocket stream endpoint for live payload pushes to the frontend.
Maintained research/backtest and scanner pipelines alongside dashboard delivery.
hard_problems: Handling live data feeds with fallback behavior when providers fail.
Keeping dashboard API and research pipelines aligned during refactor cycles.
Balancing product UI needs with ongoing strategy experimentation modules.
architecture_snapshot: Frontend Vite/React app under `dashboard/frontend/` consumes backend API and websocket feeds.
FastAPI backend at `dashboard/backend/app/main.py` aggregates candles, orderbook, news, and analytics.
Realtime stream is exposed at websocket route `WS /ws`.
Persistence and calculations depend on Postgres and local analytics code paths.
Scanner, trading, and backtest modules exist outside dashboard app for strategy workflows.
SQL change scripts are tracked in `sql/` for schema-related updates.

key_directories: `dashboard/backend/app/` contains FastAPI app modules and websocket endpoint.
`dashboard/frontend/src/components/` contains market, chart, and control components.
`scanner/` and `trading/` contain live scanning and execution logic.
`backtest/strategies/` contains strategy modules for offline evaluation.
`sql/` contains SQL scripts used for system evolution.
how_it_runs: Full stack option: `docker compose --profile full up --build` from `dashboard/`.

projects.title: Betty Sports Betting Research Platform
projects.description: Realtime data ingestion and scoring engine for research workflows across sportsbook and prediction-market feeds.
what_i_built: Implemented connector abstraction for websocket and REST sources.
Built scoring engine with weighted factor modules and utilities.
Added database models for markets, odds, bets, and performance records.
Set up Docker local environment and test scaffolding.
hard_problems: Normalizing multiple external feed formats into one scoring pipeline.
Maintaining freshness while coordinating async connectors and persistence.
Designing retry and reconnect behavior for websocket-driven ingestion.
architecture_snapshot: Connector manager orchestrates websocket and REST connector lifecycles.
Websocket adapters include Kalshi and Betfair stream handlers.
REST adapters include odds, ESPN, and weather providers.
Scoring engine computes weighted opportunity scores.
Data models and DB layer store odds snapshots and tracked outcomes.
Redis cache layer is available for low-latency state caching.

projects.title: AVRYai Sales Copilot
projects.description: Realtime assistant for call transcription and next-response guidance across meeting and telephony streams.
what_i_built: Implemented FastAPI websocket endpoints for meeting and telephony media streams.
Built copilot frontend overlay flow in React for live suggestion delivery.
Added meeting bot and phone-call control endpoints for runtime orchestration.
Maintained desktop wrapper configuration in Tauri for local operator workflows.
hard_problems: Synchronizing live audio streams with transcript/suggestion timing.
Managing multiple websocket channels for different call transport types.
Handling call lifecycle transitions while keeping frontend session state coherent.
architecture_snapshot: FastAPI backend in `backend/main.py` handles control and websocket routes.
Frontend React app under `frontend/src/` renders copilot UI state.
Tauri workspace under `avryai-copilot-tauri/` provides desktop shell packaging.
Backend integrates speech transcription and LLM suggestion clients.
Realtime channels include meeting-bot, telco stream, and frontend copilot websocket paths.

how_it_runs: Desktop shell uses the Tauri workspace under `avryai-copilot-tauri/`.

projects.title: AVRYai Admin Dashboard
projects.description: Operations dashboard for conversations, leads, clients, and activity monitoring.
what_i_built: Built authenticated admin UI flows for login, dashboard, and conversation detail pages.
Implemented API service layer with auth token injection and request helpers.
Added pagination/filter support for conversations and leads retrieval.
Prepared production build and deployment outputs through Vite pipeline.
hard_problems: Maintaining usable UI for operational lists while data volume grows.
Handling auth expiration and session transitions cleanly on the client.
Keeping dashboard refresh behavior responsive without overloading API requests.
architecture_snapshot: React app entrypoint in `src/main.jsx` mounts route-driven admin UI.
Service client in `src/services/api.js` wraps axios with auth interceptors.
Page modules in `src/pages/` separate dashboard, conversation, and login workflows.
Context layer in `src/contexts/AuthContext.jsx` centralizes auth state.
Vite build outputs static artifacts for deployment under `dist/`.

how_it_runs: Build and preview: `npm run build` then `npm run preview`.
